title: "Gala" Art Deco narrow sans
content:
I am curious as to what font the GALA is. I think the serif font is Trajan Bold.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120204608im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Tullis1.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Carolina Herrera wide serif logo - Engravers Roman {Mike Y et al}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120204608/http:/typophile.com/node/18705 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Lifecore Fitness logo, similar to Serpentine - Vibrocentric {Dav} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120204608/http:/typophile.com/node/18747 "Go to next forum topic")
author: signs79

comments.content: I haven’t seen a deco font quite that tall. [Blakely](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120204608/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=MSF.118742.0.0) is close.

Possibly hand drawn, but you can get pretty close with [URW Newport Land](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120204608/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.109933.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=GALA&sampleSize=144)
oops. Obviously didn’t read your post, Yves. 0:^)

Guest Check, from Font Diner (Brown Bag font set)  
 [http://fontdiner.com/main.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080120204608/http:/fontdiner.com/main.html "http://fontdiner.com/main.html")
Similar indeed, but not a match — check the height of the cross bar on the G.

Or just contact them:

The well-known-great Production Manager is Jim Bradford

jimb[@]eugeneopera.com
